result.execSummary:
The defendant Roland Price Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roland Price Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Roland Price in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC pursuant to Milwaukee County Ordinance 24.01 to which Defendant plead guilty. Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge.  Court waives all mandatory and non-mandatory fees, costs and surcharges based on the 3 days time served.
All previous conditions set as to bail to remain in full force and effect.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Roland Price in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales appeared earlier in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant failing to appear.  On state's motion,  the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Roland Price in court with attorney Leija on behalf of Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Scheduling Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roland Price in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense needs additional time to review with defendant.  Court orders case adjourned for another pretrial conference in Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT INFORMED THE COURT THAT HE HAS A CARRYING CONCEAL PERMIT. Court orders the NO WEAPONS ORDER TO GO INTO EFFECT ON 9-12-2015, AT 5:00 PM. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Roland Price in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 23  for a Pretrial Conference.
As of 9-14-2015, case will be reassigned to Branch 45, Judge Havas.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 09-11-2015 at 01:30pm
